Issues.Title: Fix form missing from Application.OpenForms after RecreateHandle
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9029


## Proposed changes

Not remove form form `Application.OpenForms` during `RecreateHandle` call.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

`Application.OpenForms` will be actual even after `RecreateHandle` call in some forms.

## Regression? 

No

## Risk

I think no at all.


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

Integration test added.

Issues.Title: PropertyGrid GDI handle leak in .NET 7.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PropertyGrid GDI handle leak in .NET 7.0" (#9028)

Issues.Title: Fix GDI handle leak in GridEntry.
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9028

This is a regression in .NET 7.0. Resizing a `PropertyGrid` control will continue to leak GDI handles until they are exhausted, eventually crashing the application.

There is no workaround as this is a native handle leak.

Validated repro manually.

Issues.Title: The form title bar of an MDI child form is shown under the main bar in High DPI
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

All frameworks (.NET 4.8, .NET 7, .NET 8)

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

My name is Nadezhda. I'm a software engineer representing the WinForms team at DevExpress.
We found that a child MDI title bar can be shown under the main bar when MDI forms are shown on a screen with High DPI settings. It's important to resolve this issue because a lot of users use High DPI settings on their monitors.
The current behavior:
![Current](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37904867/234592050-228d0196-16ad-4754-bd9e-3a38444c9f04.png)
The expected result is that only the main bar will be displayed as it is shown on the main monitor:
![Expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37904867/234593046-66e939e0-e512-4579-9a72-24e97591df43.png)


### Steps to reproduce

I attached a project ([MDI_PM2.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11333460/MDI_PM2.zip)) that demonstrates this behavior using only standard forms.
To reproduce this issue, you need to use two monitors. The first monitor (it should be the main monitor) should have 100 % scaling. The second should have non-default scaling (for example, 175%).
In this case, you can just run the attached project and show its form in the main form. After that, move the form to the second monitor.
[MDI_PM2.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11333460/MDI_PM2.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The form title bar of an MDI child form is shown under the main bar in High DPI" (#9047)

Issues.Title: ContextMenu items with checkboxes are displayed badly in PMv2 HDPI
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

In Per-Monitor v2 scenario, the contextmenu items with checkbox causes the contextmenu items having wrong height and the checkbox is not fully visible.
My scenario is 175% primary screen, 100% secondary screen. The sample app looks fine on the primary one, but gets broken on the secondary.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3384955/234545227-eea00d20-c53c-4f31-af7d-840966cb5b15.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3384955/234545240-ae65cda4-839f-4280-94bd-dc520b310502.png)
[DpiTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11331626/DpiTest.zip)



### Steps to reproduce

Set up a primary screen to 175%, secondary to 100%
Run the attached DpiTest project on the secondary screen.
One button opens simple context menu, while the second button opens a contextmenu where the first item is checked.
On the secondary screen, the second contextmenu is not displayed correctly
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ContextMenu items with checkboxes are displayed badly in PMv2 HDPI" (#9044)

Issues.Title: `MessageBox.Show` overload with `StartPosition` parameter
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

When Messagebox.Show is called, often it will be associated to an open window. The messagebox will show in the middle of the monitor. This is not really user friendly when the user has a large monitor or when using non-maximized forms.

Example of users working around the problem:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1732443/center-messagebox-in-parent-form

### API Proposal

```csharp
namespace System.Windows.Forms;

public enum MessageBoxStartPosition
{
Default = 0,
CenterScreen = 1,
CenterParent = 2
}

public static DialogResult Show(
            string? text,
            string? caption,
            MessageBoxButtons buttons,
            MessageBoxIcon icon,
            MessageBoxDefaultButton defaultButton,
            MessageBoxOptions options,
            MessageBoxStartPosition startPosition)
```


### API Usage

```csharp
MessageBox.Show("Test Message box text","Test Caption", 
MessageBoxButtons.OK, MessageBoxIcon.Error, MessageBoxStartPosition.CenterParent)
```


### Alternative Designs

_No response_

### Risks

_No response_

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`MessageBox.Show` overload with `StartPosition` parameter" (#9043)

Issues.Title: Compute Anchors for Nested containers.
Issues.Body:
- Controls anchored within the nested containers are never getting chance to compute `AnchorInfo `in V2 layout and thus seeing issues mentioned in #8933. 
- Explicit bounds change on the control either by setting Properties like `Size`, `Location` or by calling public APIs `SetBounds` should recompute `AnchorsInfo` for the control. We documented this but missed in the validation. Issue #8494.
- Added unit tests covering these scenarios.

Fixes #8933 
Fixes #8494 

Anchor UI needs VS servicing to pick these changes.

replacing #9006.

Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-preview.3.23178.7

### Issue description

The app shows a prompt to install Preview 4, but Preview 4 is not available to community contributors.

This link is given:
https://aka.ms/dotnet-core-applaunch?framework=Microsoft.NETCore.App&&framework_version=8.0.0-preview.4.23221.1&&arch=x64&&rid=win10-x64&&gui=true

As you can see, when this link is used, it redirects to downloading Preview 3 instead of 4:
https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/thank-you/runtime-desktop-8.0.0-preview.3-windows-x64-installer?cid=getdotnetcore

(Also, the "Show details/hide details" window is extremely broken on 200% DPI screens. If you click it multiple times, it blocks everything on the screen.)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8040367/233797337-a63eb333-4d55-4827-9ecb-1ad30712d099.png)


### Steps to reproduce

Clone repo, run `Restore.cmd`, install .NET SDK 8.0.100-preview.3.23178.7, select the WinformsControlTest project as the startup project, press F5.

Issues.Title: Unckeck one listview item is unchecking all checked items
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Unckeck-one-listview-item-is-unchecking-/10347342)._

---
[severity:It's more difficult to complete my work]
In a Windows form I have a tabcontrol. In code, I create a tabpage with a listview and I add a handler for the listview ItemCheck event. 
The listview multiselect property is set to TRUE. 
The handler select/deselect the listview item conforms the user check/uncheck it.
It works fine for check listview items, but when you uncheck just one item, all the others checked items are unchecked too.

This is the code:
```
Imports Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging
Imports System.Globalization
Imports System.Security.Policy
Public Class Form1

    Private Sub Form1_Load(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
        Dim txt As String = "02/2023"
        Dim lv As ListView
        Dim pg As TabPage

        Me.TabControl1.TabPages.Clear()
        pg = NewTabPage(Me.TabControl1, txt)
        lv = pg.Controls(0)
        Me.TabControl1.SelectTab(0)
    End Sub

    Private Function NewTabPage(ByRef TabCtrl As TabControl, ByVal txt As String) As TabPage

        For Each tp As TabPage In TabCtrl.TabPages
            If tp.Text = txt Then
                tp.Select()
                NewTabPage = tp
                Exit Function
            End If
        Next

        Dim lv As New ListView
        Dim pg As New TabPage With {.Text = txt}
        TabCtrl.TabPages.Add(pg)

        With lv
            .Parent = pg
            .Name = txt
            .View = View.Details
            .Dock = DockStyle.Fill
            .LabelEdit = False
            .AllowColumnReorder = True
            .CheckBoxes = True
            .FullRowSelect = True
            .GridLines = True
            .HeaderStyle = ColumnHeaderStyle.Clickable
            .MultiSelect = True
            .Columns.Add("MONTH", 100, HorizontalAlignment.Center)
            .Columns.Add("BRANCH", 60, HorizontalAlignment.Center)
            .Columns.Add("ACCT", 60, HorizontalAlignment.Left)
            .Columns.Add("SSN", 100, HorizontalAlignment.Center)
            .Columns.Add("CUSTOMER", 140, HorizontalAlignment.Left)
            pg.Controls.Add(lv)
            AddHandler .ItemCheck, AddressOf Me.lv_ItemCheck
        End With

        For i As Integer = 1 To 10
            Dim lvi As New ListViewItem(txt & Format(i, "-00"))
            With lvi
                .SubItems.Add("0001")
                .SubItems.Add("BB" & Format(100 * i, "-0000"))
                .SubItems.Add("001.01234-12" & Format(i, "-00"))
                .SubItems.Add("STAR DRUGSTORE " & Format(i, "00"))
                lv.Items.Add(lvi)
            End With
        Next
        pg.Select()
        pg.Focus()
        NewTabPage = pg

    End Function

    Public Sub lv_ItemCheck(sender As Object, e As ItemCheckEventArgs)
        Dim lv As ListView = sender
        Dim ix As Integer = e.Index

        If e.CurrentValue = CheckState.Checked Then
            lv.Items(ix).Selected = False
        Else
            lv.Items(ix).Selected = True
        End If
    End Sub

End Class

```
- Windows 10 Pro Version 10.0.19044, PT-BR
- MS Visual Studio Professional 2022(64 bits) - Current Version 17.5.4
- Directs to .NET 6.0.
- MS .NET Framework version 4.8.04084

---

(private comment, text removed)

---

(no solutions)

Issues.Title: Form is removed from Application.OpenForms after RecreateHandle
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net6, .Net7 checked.

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I checked only .Net6, .Net7 but according to the code, problem exist in all versions (.net framework too).

### Issue description

While working on https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/3606  I found that after calling to `RecreateHandle`, the form is completely removed from `Application.OpenForms`.

The form is added to `Application.OpenForms` in two cases:
1. `OnLoad`.
2. `SetVisibleCore(true)`  

The form is removed from `Application.OpenForms` in two cases:
1. `OnFormClosed`.
2. `OnHandleDestroyed` 

Here we clearly see that after `RecreateHandle` we will completely lost our form from `Application.OpenForms` :( We call `RecreateHandle` for the form in several cases (`ShowInTaskbar` \ `RightToLeft` change etc...).
I still can't say for sure how much duplication of the `Application.OpenForms.Remove` call in `OnHandleDestroyed` is necessary.

### Steps to reproduce

[FormCloseTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11304011/FormCloseTest.zip)

0. Build.
1. Run.
2. Press button2 => `Application.OpenForms` will contains 3 forms (main, mdiParent and mdiChild).
3. Press button3 => `Application.OpenForms` will contains 1 form - main.
